noun.description: The action or fact of elevating or being elevated.
examples: her sudden elevation to the cabinet

noun.description: Height above a given level, especially sea level.
examples: a network of microclimates created by sharp differences in elevation
a total elevation gain of 3,995 feet

noun.description: A particular side of a building.
examples: a burglar alarm was prominently displayed on the front elevation

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin elevatio(n-), from elevare raise (see elevate).
